member.name: T:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ThumbButton
member.summary: Represents a taskbar thumbnail button in the thumbnail toolbar.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ThumbButton.Clicked
member.summary: The event that occurs when the taskbar thumbnail button is clicked.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ThumbButton.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets thumbnail button's id.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ThumbButton.Icon
member.summary: Gets or sets the thumbnail button's icon.

member.summary: Gets or sets the thumbnail button's tooltip.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ThumbButton.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets the thumbnail button's visibility.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ThumbButton.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the thumbnail button's enabled state.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UI.WindowsFormsExtensions
member.summary: Contains extension methods for easier Windows Forms interoperability.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UI.WindowsFormsExtensions.SetAppId(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.String)
member.summary: Sets this form's application id.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UI.WindowsFormsExtensions.GetAppId(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary: Gets this form's application id.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UI.WindowsFormsExtensions.EnableCustomWindowPreview(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary: Enables custom window preview on this form, meaning that the DWM will send messages when a live thumbnail preview or a live peek will be necessary.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UI.WindowsFormsExtensions.DisableCustomWindowPreview(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary: Disables custom window preview on this form, meaning that the DWM will not send messages when a live thumbnail preview or a live peek will be necessary, but instead rely on its default rendering.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UI.WindowsFormsExtensions.SetIconicThumbnail(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Sets this form's iconic thumbnail to the specified bitmap.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UI.WindowsFormsExtensions.SetPeekBitmap(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets this form's peek (live preview) bitmap.
member.param: Whether to display a standard window frame around the bitmap.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UI.WindowsFormsExtensions.SetTaskbarOverlayIcon(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.Drawing.Icon,System.String)
member.summary: Draws the specified overlay icon over this form's taskbar button.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UI.WindowsFormsExtensions.SetTaskbarProgress(System.Windows.Forms.ProgressBar)
member.summary: Sets the progress bar in the containing form's taskbar button to this progress bar's progress.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UI.WindowsFormsExtensions.SetTaskbarProgress(System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripProgressBar)
member.summary: Sets the progress bar in the containing form's taskbar button to this toolstrip progress bar's progress.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UI.WindowsFormsExtensions.SetTaskbarProgress(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the progress bar of this form's taskbar button to the specified percentage.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UI.WindowsFormsExtensions.SetTaskbarProgressState(System.Windows.Forms.Form,Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.ThumbnailProgressState)
member.summary: Sets the progress bar of this form's taskbar button to the specified state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UI.WindowsFormsExtensions.CreateProgressEnabledBackgroundWorker(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary: Creates a background worker that dispatches progress notifications to the application's taskbar button.
member.returns: An instance of that reports progress through the application's taskbar button.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UI.WindowsFormsExtensions.CreateThumbButtonManager(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary: Creates a taskbar thumbnail button manager for this form.
member.returns: An object of type that can be used to add and manage thumbnail toolbar buttons.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UI.WindowsFormsExtensions.CreateJumpListManager(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary: Creates a jump list manager for this form.
member.returns: An object of type that can be used to manage the application's jump list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UI.WindowsFormsExtensions.SetThumbnailClip(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Specifies that only a portion of the form's client area should be used in the form's thumbnail.
member.param: The rectangle that specifies the clipped region.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UI.WindowsFormsExtensions.SetThumbnailTooltip(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the specified form's thumbnail tooltip.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar
member.summary: The primary coordinator of the Windows 7 taskbar-related activities. For additional functionality, see the and classes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.GetWindowAppId(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets a window's application id by its window handle.
member.returns: The application id of that window.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.SetWindowAppId(System.IntPtr,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the window's application id by its window handle.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.SetCurrentProcessAppId(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the current process' explicit application user model id.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.GetCurrentProcessAppId
member.summary: Gets the current process' explicit application user model id.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.EnableCustomWindowPreview(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Indicates that the specified window requests the DWM to demand live preview (thumbnail and peek) mode when necessary instead of relying on default preview.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.DisableCustomWindowPreview(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Indicates that the specified window does not require the DWM to demand live preview (thumbnail and peek) mode when necessary, i.e. this window relies on default preview.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.SetIconicThumbnail(System.IntPtr,System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Sets the specified iconic thumbnail for the specified window. This is typically done in response to a DWM message.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.SetPeekBitmap(System.IntPtr,System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the specified peek (live preview) bitmap for the specified window. This is typically done in response to a DWM message.
member.param: Whether to display a standard window frame around the bitmap.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.SetTaskbarOverlayIcon(System.IntPtr,System.Drawing.Icon,System.String)
member.summary: Draws the specified overlay icon on the specified window's taskbar button.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.SetProgressState(System.IntPtr,Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.ThumbnailProgressState)
member.summary: Sets the progress state of the specified window's taskbar button.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.SetProgressValue(System.IntPtr,System.UInt64,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Sets the progress value of the specified window's taskbar button.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.SetThumbnailClip(System.IntPtr,System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Specifies that only a portion of the window's client area should be used in the window's thumbnail.
member.param: The rectangle that specifies the clipped region.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.SetThumbnailTooltip(System.IntPtr,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the specified window's thumbnail tooltip.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.AllowTaskbarWindowMessagesThroughUIPI
member.summary: Specifies that the taskbar- and DWM-related windows messages should pass through the Windows UIPI mechanism even if the process is running elevated. Calling this method is not required unless the process is running elevated.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.ThumbnailProgressState
member.summary: Represents the thumbnail progress bar state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.ThumbnailProgressState.NoProgress
member.summary: No progress is displayed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.ThumbnailProgressState.Indeterminate
member.summary: The progress is indeterminate (marquee).

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.ThumbnailProgressState.Normal
member.summary: Normal progress is displayed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.ThumbnailProgressState.Error
member.summary: An error occurred (red).

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Windows7Taskbar.ThumbnailProgressState.Paused
member.summary: The operation is paused (yellow).

member.name: T:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.BitmapRequestedEventArgs
member.summary: The event arguments object for the thumbnail request and peek preview request events published by the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.BitmapRequestedEventArgs.Width
member.summary: Gets the requested bitmap's width.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.BitmapRequestedEventArgs.Height
member.summary: Gets the requested bitmap's height.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.BitmapRequestedEventArgs.DoNotMirrorBitmap
member.summary: Specifies whether the provided bitmap is already mirrored. DWM thumbnail and peek bitmaps must be mirrored vertically. If this flag is set to false, the will mirror the bitmap automatically.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.BitmapRequestedEventArgs.DisplayFrameAroundBitmap
member.summary: Specifies whether a standard window frame will be displayed around the bitmap. If the bitmap represents a top-level window, you would probably set this flag to true. If the bitmap represents a child window (or a frameless window), you would probably set this flag to false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.BitmapRequestedEventArgs.Bitmap
member.summary: Sets the bitmap requested by the sender. If the bitmap doesn't have the right dimensions, the DWM may scale it or not render certain areas as appropriate - it is the user's responsibility to render a bitmap with the proper dimensions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.CustomWindowsManager
member.summary: Manages custom window representations in taskbar thumbnails and DWM peek preview (Aero Peek).

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.CustomWindowsManager.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class using the specified window handle and enables custom window preview on the window.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.CustomWindowsManager.DispatchMessage(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Dispatches a window message so that the appropriate events can be invoked.
member.param: The window message, typically obtained from a Windows Forms or WPF window procedure.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.CustomWindowsManager.PeekRequested
member.summary: The event that occurs when a peek bitmap must be provided for the window.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.CustomWindowsManager.ThumbnailRequested
member.summary: The event that occurs when a thumbnail must be provided for the window.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager
member.summary: Provides services to manage taskbar jump lists, including custom destinations and custom tasks.
member.remarks: This class mostly borrows the Windows Shell's concepts where jump lists are concerned including: Application destinations - Destinations added to the application's recent and frequent categories by the shell or by the application. Custom destinations - Destinations added to the application's jump list in other categories by the application. Tasks - Tasks added to the application's jump list. The methods of this class are not thread-safe.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the jump list manager with the specified application id.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the jump list manager with the specified window handle.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.AddUserTask(Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.IJumpListTask)
member.summary: Adds a task to the application's jump list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.DeleteTask(Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.IJumpListTask)
member.summary: Deletes the specified task from the application's jump list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.ClearTasks
member.summary: Deletes all the tasks from the application's jump list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.AddCustomDestination(Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.IJumpListDestination)
member.summary: Adds a custom destination to the application's jump list.
member.param: An object implementing such as or .

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.GetCustomDestinationsByCategory(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the custom destinations belonging to the specified category from this application's jump list. If destinations are modified through the use of this property, the method must be called to repopulate the application's jump list.
member.returns: A collection of destinations of type .

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.DeleteCustomDestination(Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.IJumpListDestination)
member.summary: Deletes the specified custom destination from the application's jump list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.AddToRecent(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the specified destination to the application's recent destinations list.
member.remarks: If the recent and frequent categories are disabled, this method has no visual effect on the jump list in the recent and frequent categories respectively.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.AddToRecent(Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.IJumpListDestination)
member.summary: Adds the specified destination to the application's recent destinations list.
member.remarks: If the recent and frequent categories are disabled, this method has no visual effect on the jump list in the recent and frequent categories respectively.
member.param: An object implementing such as or .

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.ClearAllDestinations
member.summary: Removes all destinations from the application's jump list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.ClearApplicationDestinations
member.summary: Removes all application destinations (such as frequent and recent) from the application's jump list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.GetApplicationDestinations(Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ApplicationDestinationType)
member.summary: Retrieves all application destinations belonging to the specified application destination type.
member.returns: A copy of the application destinations belonging to the specified type; modifying the returned objects has no effect on the application's destination list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.DeleteApplicationDestination(Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.IJumpListDestination)
member.summary: Deletes the specified application destination from the application's jump list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.ClearCustomDestinations
member.summary: Deletes all custom destinations from the application's jump list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.Refresh
member.summary: Repopulates the application's jump list. Use this method after all current changes to the application's jump list have been introduced, and you want the list to be refreshed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.Dispose
member.summary: Cleans the resources associated with this jump list.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.Tasks
member.summary: Retrieves the tasks currently present in the application's jump list. If the tasks are modified through the use of this property, the method must be called to repopulate the application's jump list.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.CustomDestinationCategories
member.summary: Retrieves all custom destination categories in this application's jump list.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.EnabledAutoDestinationType
member.summary: The currently enabled automatic application destination type. The supported values are the values of the enumeration. Only of the values can be set at any given time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.MaximumSlotsInList
member.summary: Returns the maximum number of items to be placed in the application's jump list. This number depends on factors such as the display resolution or monitor change - do not assume it is always constant.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListManager.UserRemovedItems
member.summary: Register to this event to receive notifications when custom destinations are being removed from your jump list by the user. If you do not register to this event, you will not be able to refresh the list. Additionally, if you attempt to add items to the list which have been previously removed by the user, the next refresh will fail to add your category.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ApplicationDestinationType
member.summary: The application destination type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ApplicationDestinationType.NONE
member.summary: No application destination type is selected.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ApplicationDestinationType.Recent
member.summary: Destinations used recently.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ApplicationDestinationType.Frequent
member.summary: Destinations used frequently.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UserRemovedItemsEventArgs
member.summary: The event arguments for the event that occurs when the user removes items from the application's jump list.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UserRemovedItemsEventArgs.RemovedItems
member.summary: The collection of removed items. Each item is the path.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.UserRemovedItemsEventArgs.CancelCurrentOperation
member.summary: Set to true if the current operation should be cancelled. Should be used by the application if because of the items the user has removed there is no real work to do with the jump list.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListDestinations
member.summary: A collection of categorized jump list destinations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.JumpListTasks
member.summary: A collection of jump list tasks.

member.summary: Represents a shell object that can be inserted to an application's jump list.

member.summary: Gets the shell representation of an object, such as IShellLink or IShellItem.

member.summary: Gets or sets the object's title.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.IJumpListShellObject.Path
member.summary: Gets or sets the object's path.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.IJumpListDestination
member.summary: Represents a jump list destination.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.IJumpListDestination.Category
member.summary: Gets or sets the destination's category.

member.summary: Represents a jump list task.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.IJumpListTask.Arguments
member.summary: Gets or sets the task's command line arguments.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.WindowShowCommand
member.summary: Flags controlling the appearance of a window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.WindowShowCommand.Hide
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.WindowShowCommand.Normal
member.summary: Activates and displays the window (including restoring it to its original size and position).

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.WindowShowCommand.Minimized
member.summary: Minimizes the window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.WindowShowCommand.Maximized
member.summary: Maximizes the window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.WindowShowCommand.ShowNoActivate
member.summary: Similar to , except that the window is not activated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.WindowShowCommand.Show
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.WindowShowCommand.Minimize
member.summary: Minimizes the window and activates the next top-level window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.WindowShowCommand.ShowMinimizedNoActivate
member.summary: Minimizes the window and does not activate it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.WindowShowCommand.ShowNA
member.summary: Similar to , except that the window is not activated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.WindowShowCommand.Restore
member.summary: Activates and displays the window, restoring it to its original size and position.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.WindowShowCommand.Default
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the initial value specified when the process was created.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.WindowShowCommand.ForceMinimize
member.summary: Minimizes a window, even if the thread owning the window is not responding. Use this only to minimize windows from a different thread.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.Separator
member.summary: Represents a separator in the task area of the jump list. There is no need to set any properties on this class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the object's working directory.

member.summary: Gets or sets the show command of the launched application.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ShellLink.IsSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating that the shell link is a menu separator. If this flag is set, all other properties are ignored.

member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ThumbButtonManager
member.summary: Manages a set of taskbar thumbnail buttons in an application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ThumbButtonManager.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Initializes a new manager with the specified window handle.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ThumbButtonManager.CreateThumbButton(System.UInt32,System.Drawing.Icon,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new taskbar thumbnail button.
member.returns: An object of type representing the newly created thumbnail button.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ThumbButtonManager.DispatchMessage(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Dispatches a Windows message to the thumbnail button event handlers if appropriate.
member.remarks: This method is intended for infrastructure use only.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ThumbButtonManager.AddThumbButtons(Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ThumbButton[])
member.summary: Adds the specified taskbar thumbnail buttons to the application's thumbnail toolbar.
member.remarks: Thumbnail buttons can only be added once - after being added, they cannot be removed or deleted. However, they can be shown, hidden, enabled and disabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SDK.Samples.SevenBridge.Taskbar.ThumbButtonManager.Item(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Gets a specific thumbnail button by its id.
member.returns: An object of type with the specified id.
